result.execSummary:
The defendant Shad L Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.
No violent contact with the victim.
No contact with the victim's residence.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shad L Garcia in court with Attorney Jennifer Flynn.  Barbara Ann Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Flynn makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER 

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No violent contact with: victim 
____No contact with:  victim's residence 
____40 hours of community service 

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,  immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department**
Dated 04/01/16, from Atty Flynn to Judge Carter, with attached documents for 04/08/16 sentencing hearing.

Attorney Jennifer Flynn in court.   Defendant Shad L Garcia did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Flynn requests a plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Shad L Garcia in court with Attorney Jennifer Flynn.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Flynn requests an adjournment to review materials.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Anna Kees in court for Attorney Jennifer Flynn.   Defendant Shad L Garcia did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kees states that they are still in negotiations with the state and requests an adjournment.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Shad L Garcia in court with attorney Jessica Rowe for attorney Jennifer Flynn.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
